title: If you could switch on a weaponized, entirely solipsistic artificial General Intelligence, would you do it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Solipsism: a theory holding that the self can know nothing but its own modifications and that the self is the only existent thing Given that word in combination with “weaponized” I should think no sane person would turn it on. Is there even another answer to this? Your basically positing an AI that is designed to be dangerous (weaponized) and believes itself to be the only actual thing in existence which means it cannot have any sort of respect for other life of any sort. We have enough to worry about without building in solipsism and weaponizing to our hypothetical AGI. Merely failing to align the value systems would be enough.

Switch on at least three such networks at the same time. You’d think the whole “solipsism” thing would not stand up in the face of contrary evidence, you-n-me aside.OMG ! Can you imagine the lawsuits ?You madman ! If there is real-world History to appeal to, it is that Humans don’t Trust their machine creations. WE have always insisted the Computer tell us Why it made the decision it did before implementing their insights in the real world.
